20110111162727.000|20110111162730.000|TR0|of Haiti's earthquake. One year later, the 
20110111162730.000|20110111162732.000|TR0|pediatrician who saved her life meets the 
20110111162732.000|20110111162734.000|TR0|little girl and her grateful mother.

20110111162737.000|20110111162739.000|TR0|touching story for you next.
20110111162739.000|20110111162742.000|TR0|

20110111162744.000|20110111162747.000|TR0|
20110111162747.000|20110111162749.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  Haiti, one year after the 
20110111162749.000|20110111162752.000|TR0|devastating earthquake. Tomorrow marks the 
20110111162752.000|20110111162754.000|TR0|first anniversary of that horror, when a 
20110111162754.000|20110111162756.000|TR0|magnitude 7 quake crumbled much of the 
20110111162756.000|20110111162759.000|TR0|capital, killing more than 200,000 people 
20110111162759.000|20110111162801.000|TR0|and leaving about a million homeless.
20110111162801.000|20110111162804.000|TR0|
20110111162804.000|20110111162806.000|TR0|While there is noticeable progress in some 
20110111162806.000|20110111162809.000|TR0|areas, rebuilding is still slow, despite 
20110111162809.000|20110111162811.000|TR0|pledges of millions of dollars in 
20110111162811.000|20110111162814.000|TR0|international aid.       So much time has 
20110111162814.000|20110111162816.000|TR0|passed and there are so many sad stories 
20110111162816.000|20110111162818.000|TR0|to tell.  But in the midst of all of this 
20110111162818.000|20110111162821.000|TR0|bad news, CNN Senior Medical Correspondent

20110111163300.000|20110111163302.000|TR0|therapy because her arms were crushed, and 
20110111163302.000|20110111163304.000|TR0|they want to make sure that they continue 
20110111163304.000|20110111163307.000|TR0|to heal properly.  She is doing great and 
20110111163307.000|20110111163309.000|TR0|her father already has a job -- Carol.
20110111163309.000|20110111163312.000|TR0|

20110111163541.000|20110111163543.000|TR0|Loughner is expected to be back in court 
20110111163543.000|20110111163546.000|TR0|on January 24th.  Loughner, who wore a 
20110111163546.000|20110111163548.000|TR0|broad smile for his mug shot, will remain 
20110111163548.000|20110111163551.000|TR0|behind bars.  A federal judge agreed with 
20110111163551.000|20110111163553.000|TR0|prosecutors that Loughner is a danger to 
20110111163553.000|20110111163556.000|TR0|the community.  He faces two federal 
20110111163556.000|20110111163558.000|TR0|murder counts for the death of a judge and 
20110111163558.000|20110111163601.000|TR0|a Congressional staff member.  He's also 
20110111163601.000|20110111163603.000|TR0|charged with the attempted assassination 
20110111163603.000|20110111163605.000|TR0|of a member Congress, Representative 
20110111163605.000|20110111163608.000|TR0|Gabrielle Giffords.
20110111163608.000|20110111163610.000|TR0|
20110111163610.000|20110111163613.000|TR0|Well, we may know who might be responsible 
20110111163613.000|20110111163615.000|TR0|for this tragedy, our understanding of why 
20110111163615.000|20110111163618.000|TR0|is still speculation.  One such theory is 
20110111163618.000|20110111163620.000|TR0|that mental illness drove Loughner to 
20110111163620.000|20110111163623.000|TR0|kill.  According to Dr. E. Fuller Torrey, 
20110111163623.000|20110111163625.000|TR0|a research psychiatrist, specializing in 
20110111163625.000|20110111163627.000|TR0|mental illness, it's very likely that 
20110111163627.000|20110111163630.000|TR0|Jared Loughner is exhibiting symptoms of 
20110111163630.000|20110111163632.000|TR0|schizophrenia.  We'll talk to Dr. Torrey 
20110111163632.000|20110111163635.000|TR0|in just a moment.
20110111163635.000|20110111163637.000|TR0|
20110111163637.000|20110111163640.000|TR0|But, if all of this is true, Loughner 
20110111163640.000|20110111163642.000|TR0|would not be the first schizophrenic to 
20110111163642.000|20110111163645.000|TR0|launch an assassination attempt.  In 1998, 
20110111163645.000|20110111163647.000|TR0|Ted Kaczynski, the Unabomber, pleaded 
20110111163647.000|20110111163649.000|TR0|guilty to a seven-year string of bombings 
20110111163649.000|20110111163652.000|TR0|that killed three people and injured 29.  
20110111163652.000|20110111163654.000|TR0|A government psychiatrist diagnosed him as 
20110111163654.000|20110111163657.000|TR0|a paranoid schizophrenic.  In 1980, Mark 
20110111163657.000|20110111163659.000|TR0|David Chapman, another diagnosed 
20110111163659.000|20110111163702.000|TR0|schizophrenic, shot John Lennon.  And when 
20110111163702.000|20110111163704.000|TR0|John Hinkley Jr. attempted to assassinate 
20110111163704.000|20110111163707.000|TR0|President Ronald Reagan in 1981, he was 
20110111163707.000|20110111163709.000|TR0|found not-guilty by reason of insanity.
20110111163709.000|20110111163711.000|TR0|
20110111163711.000|20110111163714.000|TR0|We want to be clear here, though, violence 
20110111163714.000|20110111163716.000|TR0|is not a symptom of schizophrenia, 
20110111163716.000|20110111163719.000|TR0|according to the medical community.  It's 
20110111163719.000|20110111163721.000|TR0|important to note that an estimated 2.4 
20110111163721.000|20110111163724.000|TR0|million Americans suffer from this 
20110111163724.000|20110111163726.000|TR0|disease. So Loughner would certainly not 
20110111163726.000|20110111163729.000|TR0|be representative of the average 
20110111163729.000|20110111163731.000|TR0|schizophrenic if this is indeed the case.
20110111163731.000|20110111163733.000|TR0|
20110111163733.000|20110111163736.000|TR0|Dr. E. Fuller Torrey joins me now.  He's a 
20110111163736.000|20110111163738.000|TR0|research psychologist specializing in 
20110111163738.000|20110111163741.000|TR0|schizophrenia and manic depressive 
20110111163741.000|20110111163743.000|TR0|illness, and founder of the Treatment 
20110111163743.000|20110111163746.000|TR0|Advocacy Center.
20110111163746.000|20110111163748.000|TR0|

20110111163751.000|20110111163753.000|TR0|morning.
20110111163753.000|20110111163755.000|TR0|
20110111163755.000|20110111163758.000|TR0|DR. E. FULLER TORREY, PSYCHIATRIST, :  
20110111163758.000|20110111163800.000|TR0|You're quite welcome, Carol.  Nice to be 
20110111163800.000|20110111163803.000|TR0|here.
20110111163803.000|20110111163805.000|TR0|
20110111163805.000|20110111163808.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  Let's talk about Jared 
20110111163808.000|20110111163810.000|TR0|Loughner.  You say that he was most likely 
20110111163810.000|20110111163813.000|TR0|schizophrenic.
20110111163813.000|20110111163815.000|TR0|
20110111163815.000|20110111163817.000|TR0|Why do you think so?
20110111163817.000|20110111163820.000|TR0|
20110111163820.000|20110111163822.000|TR0|TORREY:  Well, I think chances are about 
20110111163822.000|20110111163825.000|TR0|99 percent.  He has the classic symptoms 
20110111163825.000|20110111163827.000|TR0|of schizophrenia.  He meets the criteria.  
20110111163827.000|20110111163830.000|TR0|Onset in the late teens and early 20s.  He 
20110111163830.000|20110111163832.000|TR0|has clearly delusions, bizarre delusions.  
20110111163832.000|20110111163835.000|TR0|He also has evidence of changes in his 
20110111163835.000|20110111163837.000|TR0|thought processes, disorganized thinking.  
20110111163837.000|20110111163839.000|TR0|He also has changes in his emotions, 
20110111163839.000|20110111163842.000|TR0|flattening of emotions.  So, he meets all 
20110111163842.000|20110111163844.000|TR0|the criteria for schizophrenia.  I haven't 
20110111163844.000|20110111163847.000|TR0|examined him, but if somebody quacks like 
20110111163847.000|20110111163849.000|TR0|a duck and walks like a duck, we assume 
20110111163849.000|20110111163852.000|TR0|it's a duck until proven otherwise.
20110111163852.000|20110111163854.000|TR0|
20110111163854.000|20110111163857.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  And, you know, we want to be 
20110111163857.000|20110111163859.000|TR0|very clear here that the vast majority of 
20110111163859.000|20110111163901.000|TR0|schizophrenics are not violent.
20110111163901.000|20110111163904.000|TR0|
20110111163904.000|20110111163906.000|TR0|In your professional opinion, how 
20110111163906.000|20110111163909.000|TR0|dangerous are people with this disorder 
20110111163909.000|20110111163911.000|TR0|and what triggers them to be violent?
20110111163911.000|20110111163914.000|TR0|
20110111163914.000|20110111163916.000|TR0|TORREY:  It's a very important point.  
20110111163916.000|20110111163919.000|TR0|Almost all people with schizophrenia, 
20110111163919.000|20110111163921.000|TR0|almost all people with severe mental 
20110111163921.000|20110111163923.000|TR0|illnesses are not violent.  A small 
20110111163923.000|20110111163926.000|TR0|number, about one percent, will become 
20110111163926.000|20110111163928.000|TR0|violent, almost always because they are 
20110111163928.000|20110111163931.000|TR0|not being medicated.
20110111163931.000|20110111163933.000|TR0|
20110111163933.000|20110111163936.000|TR0|There is no evidence at all that people 
20110111163936.000|20110111163938.000|TR0|who are on medication are any more 
20110111163938.000|20110111163941.000|TR0|violent.  There is now abundant evidence 
20110111163941.000|20110111163943.000|TR0|that people with schizophrenia or other 
20110111163943.000|20110111163945.000|TR0|severe mental illnesses who are not taking 
20110111163945.000|20110111163948.000|TR0|medication, a small number of those, about 
20110111163948.000|20110111163950.000|TR0|one percent of the total number, will 
20110111163950.000|20110111163953.000|TR0|become violent.
20110111163953.000|20110111163955.000|TR0|
20110111163955.000|20110111163958.000|TR0|And the violence is triggered, usually by 
20110111163958.000|20110111164000.000|TR0|delusional thinking. It's not triggered by 
20110111164000.000|20110111164003.000|TR0|logical thinking.  A lot of people have 
20110111164003.000|20110111164005.000|TR0|made a big deal of the political situation 
20110111164005.000|20110111164007.000|TR0|in Arizona.  That's almost certainly not 
20110111164007.000|20110111164010.000|TR0|relevant.  It's -- the reason that this 
20110111164010.000|20110111164012.000|TR0|young man committed the act has to do with 
20110111164012.000|20110111164015.000|TR0|some strange things going on in the brain 
20110111164015.000|20110111164017.000|TR0|because of the disease of the brain.  And 
20110111164017.000|20110111164020.000|TR0|we know it is a brain disease.
20110111164020.000|20110111164022.000|TR0|
20110111164022.000|20110111164025.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  His friends say that he was 
20110111164025.000|20110111164027.000|TR0|pretty normal until he got to high school 
20110111164027.000|20110111164029.000|TR0|and then they noticed odd behavior.  Does 
20110111164029.000|20110111164032.000|TR0|schizophrenia usually strike people when 
20110111164032.000|20110111164034.000|TR0|they're older or does it develop in 
20110111164034.000|20110111164037.000|TR0|childhood?       TORREY:  Maximum is 
20110111164037.000|20110111164039.000|TR0|between 16 and 25.  My sister had 
20110111164039.000|20110111164042.000|TR0|schizophrenia, developed it at age 17.  
20110111164042.000|20110111164044.000|TR0|That's very typical on it. For reasons 
20110111164044.000|20110111164047.000|TR0|that we don't understand, it really has a 
20110111164047.000|20110111164049.000|TR0|particular age of onset.  If you get to 
20110111164049.000|20110111164051.000|TR0|age 30 and you don't have schizophrenia, 
20110111164051.000|20110111164054.000|TR0|probably you won't develop it.
20110111164054.000|20110111164056.000|TR0|
20110111164056.000|20110111164059.000|TR0|But the typical onset is almost exactly 
20110111164059.000|20110111164101.000|TR0|like it's described for Mr. Loughner, of a 
20110111164101.000|20110111164104.000|TR0|slow onset of changed behavior, strange 
20110111164104.000|20110111164106.000|TR0|thinking, often hearing voices.  Coming 
20110111164106.000|20110111164109.000|TR0|somewhere between 17, 18 and the mid- 20s.
20110111164109.000|20110111164111.000|TR0|
20110111164111.000|20110111164113.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  We're taking a look at his mug 
20110111164113.000|20110111164116.000|TR0|shot where he's smiling.  This has 
20110111164116.000|20110111164118.000|TR0|horrified many people.
20110111164118.000|20110111164121.000|TR0|
20110111164121.000|20110111164123.000|TR0|Was this by design?
20110111164123.000|20110111164126.000|TR0|
20110111164126.000|20110111164128.000|TR0|TORREY:  I think this is also a symptom of 
20110111164128.000|20110111164131.000|TR0|schizophrenia.  One of the symptoms is 
20110111164131.000|20110111164133.000|TR0|that the emotions that people have with 
20110111164133.000|20110111164135.000|TR0|schizophrenia are often quite 
20110111164135.000|20110111164138.000|TR0|inappropriate for the situation.  Clearly 
20110111164138.000|20110111164140.000|TR0|in this situation having a smiling mug 
20110111164140.000|20110111164143.000|TR0|shot is very inappropriate.  And you look 
20110111164143.000|20110111164145.000|TR0|at that, you say, well, that's consistent 
20110111164145.000|20110111164148.000|TR0|with a schizophrenia thought process.
20110111164148.000|20110111164150.000|TR0|
20110111164150.000|20110111164153.000|TR0|TORREY:  His friends, his family, the 
20110111164153.000|20110111164155.000|TR0|community college he attended, all of them 
20110111164155.000|20110111164157.000|TR0|noticed signs of mental illness, yet no 
20110111164157.000|20110111164200.000|TR0|one went to any kind of authority to 
20110111164200.000|20110111164202.000|TR0|report his erratic behavior.  And you can 
20110111164202.000|20110111164205.000|TR0|do that in Arizona, right?
20110111164205.000|20110111164207.000|TR0|
20110111164207.000|20110111164210.000|TR0|TORREY:  Yes, you can.  In fact, the laws 
20110111164210.000|20110111164212.000|TR0|in Arizona are quite reasonable, in terms 
20110111164212.000|20110111164215.000|TR0|of being able to get people into treatment 
20110111164215.000|20110111164217.000|TR0|before they've actually committed a 
20110111164217.000|20110111164219.000|TR0|violence act on it.  But, no, nobody did. 
20110111164219.000|20110111164222.000|TR0|And even if they had, the services in 
20110111164222.000|20110111164224.000|TR0|Arizona are very poor.  They're among the 
20110111164224.000|20110111164227.000|TR0|poorest in the United States.  So even if 
20110111164227.000|20110111164229.000|TR0|they had tried to, they wouldn't 
20110111164229.000|20110111164232.000|TR0|necessarily have been successful.
20110111164232.000|20110111164234.000|TR0|
20110111164234.000|20110111164237.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  So I just want to make it clear 
20110111164237.000|20110111164239.000|TR0|to people what somebody could have done in 
20110111164239.000|20110111164241.000|TR0|Arizona.  They could have reported his 
20110111164241.000|20110111164244.000|TR0|erratic behavior to local authorities and 
20110111164244.000|20110111164246.000|TR0|then he would be forced to undergo a 
20110111164246.000|20110111164249.000|TR0|mental evaluation.  But, as we know, that 
20110111164249.000|20110111164251.000|TR0|never happened.
20110111164251.000|20110111164254.000|TR0|
20110111164254.000|20110111164256.000|TR0|TORREY:  That's correct.
20110111164256.000|20110111164259.000|TR0|
20110111164259.000|20110111164301.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  And I guess people are looking 
20110111164301.000|20110111164304.000|TR0|for answers.  So, if there aren't enough 
20110111164304.000|20110111164306.000|TR0|facilities in Arizona or in most of the 
20110111164306.000|20110111164308.000|TR0|United States to take care of people with 
20110111164308.000|20110111164311.000|TR0|mental illness, what's the answer and how 
20110111164311.000|20110111164313.000|TR0|can we stop this kind of thing in the 
20110111164313.000|20110111164316.000|TR0|future?
20110111164316.000|20110111164318.000|TR0|
20110111164318.000|20110111164321.000|TR0|TORREY:  Well, ultimately it's the 
20110111164321.000|20110111164323.000|TR0|governor of the state who's responsible.  
20110111164323.000|20110111164326.000|TR0|In Arizona, they have decreased the beds.  
20110111164326.000|20110111164328.000|TR0|There's only one state in the United 
20110111164328.000|20110111164330.000|TR0|States, Nevada, that has fewer beds for 
20110111164330.000|20110111164333.000|TR0|people with severe mental illnesses than 
20110111164333.000|20110111164335.000|TR0|Arizona on it.  Ultimately the state 
20110111164335.000|20110111164338.000|TR0|legislature and the governor of Arizona 
20110111164338.000|20110111164340.000|TR0|are responsible and they should be held 
20110111164340.000|20110111164343.000|TR0|responsible by all of us.
20110111164343.000|20110111164345.000|TR0|
20110111164345.000|20110111164348.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  Doctor, thanks for joining us 
20110111164348.000|20110111164350.000|TR0|this afternoon.  We appreciate it.
20110111164350.000|20110111164352.000|TR0|
20110111164352.000|20110111164355.000|TR0|TORREY:  Quite welcome.
20110111164355.000|20110111164357.000|TR0|
20110111164357.000|20110111164400.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  Doctors will update 
20110111164400.000|20110111164402.000|TR0|Congresswoman Giffords' condition at the 
20110111164402.000|20110111164405.000|TR0|top of the hour, we're talking about the 
20110111164405.000|20110111164407.000|TR0|doctors in Tucson. We're also expecting to

20110111165638.000|20110111165640.000|TR0|COSTELLO:  The death toll in flood-ravaged 
20110111165640.000|20110111165643.000|TR0|Queensland, Australia has risen to ten.  
20110111165643.000|20110111165645.000|TR0|Rescuers found another body today while 
20110111165645.000|20110111165647.000|TR0|searching for survivors.       Heavy 
20110111165647.000|20110111165650.000|TR0|torrential rainfall has battered 
20110111165650.000|20110111165652.000|TR0|Queensland for weeks now. It's overflowing 
20110111165652.000|20110111165655.000|TR0|rivers and creeks and washing away 
20110111165655.000|20110111165657.000|TR0|everything in its path.  More than 70 
20110111165657.000|20110111165700.000|TR0|people still missing.  Most of Queensland 
20110111165700.000|20110111165702.000|TR0|has been declared a disaster zone.
20110111165702.000|20110111165705.000|TR0|
20110111165705.000|20110111165707.000|TR0|And now panic is spreading into 
20110111165707.000|20110111165709.000|TR0|neighboring Brisbane, that's Australia's 
20110111165709.000|20110111165712.000|TR0|third largest city.  The Brisbane River 
20110111165712.000|20110111165714.000|TR0|has broken its banks, and officials are 
20110111165714.000|20110111165717.000|TR0|warning people to brace for the worst 
20110111165717.000|20110111165719.000|TR0|flooding in almost 40 years.

20110111165729.000|20110111165731.000|TR0|
20110111165731.000|20110111165734.000|TR0|PHIL BLACK, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  The state 
20110111165734.000|20110111165736.000|TR0|of Queensland was preparing to move from 
20110111165736.000|20110111165739.000|TR0|crisis to recovery when the situation 
20110111165739.000|20110111165741.000|TR0|deteriorated sharply.  The death toll is 
20110111165741.000|20110111165744.000|TR0|expected to rise from flash flooding in 
20110111165744.000|20110111165746.000|TR0|the town of Toowoomba, west of Brisbane, 
20110111165746.000|20110111165749.000|TR0|with dozens of people still missing.
20110111165749.000|20110111165751.000|TR0|
20110111165751.000|20110111165753.000|TR0|Locals describe a wall of water that 
20110111165753.000|20110111165756.000|TR0|rushed through the town with pretty much 
20110111165756.000|20110111165758.000|TR0|no warning.  Cars were tossed about, 
20110111165758.000|20110111165801.000|TR0|buildings and structures moved, people 
20110111165801.000|20110111165803.000|TR0|swept away.   And they scrambled onto 
20110111165803.000|20110111165806.000|TR0|roofs, grabbed onto whatever they could, 
20110111165806.000|20110111165808.000|TR0|just to survive.
20110111165808.000|20110111165811.000|TR0|
20110111165811.000|20110111165813.000|TR0|Now, the water from that flood event is 
20110111165813.000|20110111165815.000|TR0|partly responsible for what is going to be 
20110111165815.000|20110111165818.000|TR0|the next stage in this state's flood 
20110111165818.000|20110111165820.000|TR0|crisis.  The state capital, Brisbane, is 
20110111165820.000|20110111165823.000|TR0|now under threat.  The Brisbane River has 
20110111165823.000|20110111165825.000|TR0|broken its banks.  More than 30 suburbs 
20110111165825.000|20110111165828.000|TR0|have been warned that they will be 
20110111165828.000|20110111165830.000|TR0|flooded.  That's a total of more than
